task_summary: The robot detects the fridge handle, approaches and aligns, grasps the handle, pulls to open the hinged fridge door, verifies it is open, then retreats.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 robot operates in a kitchen-like scene with a compact fridge next to a drawer unit. The goal is to open the fridge door. The robot first ensures the handle is visible (with a retrying scan if needed), drives to the frontal pose, aligns its end-effector, and sets wrist yaw for a lateral pull on a bar handle. It opens the gripper, computes a grasp on the handle, executes the grasp, and pulls via a high-level door-opening action for a hinged door. Success is verified visually, and the robot retreats to clear the workspace.
preconditions: Fridge present with a hinged door and accessible handle
Robot base within reachable distance of the handle
stepwise_plan: Check/scan for the fridge handle and detect it.
Move to the fridge front pose.
Approach and align the end-effector to the handle; set wrist yaw.
Open gripper, compute grasp pose for pulling, and pick the handle.
Execute door opening for a hinged door.
Verify the fridge is open and retreat.
success_criteria: Fridge door angle clearly increased (door open state true)
Robot is clear of the door after opening
failure_and_recovery: Handle not detected: re-scan with bounded retries
Grasp unstable: reopen gripper, recompute grasp, retry pick
Door fails to open fully: re-pull via OpenContainer with another attempt
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates once the fridge reports open and the robot has retreated to a safe distance.

frame_3.now_evidence: Arm is aligned near the handle; first firm approach visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Grasp actuation expected; leads into pulling the door.

node_specs.description: Checks if the handle is visible without scanning.
Performs a raster scan to localize the handle with bounded attempts.
Runs detection once the scan has focused on the area.
Navigate/position base to the front of the fridge.
End-effector approach and alignment to the handle with tight tolerance.
Rotate wrist to prepare a lateral pull grasp.
Verify the wrist yaw is correctly set.
Compute pulling grasp on the handle and store on blackboard.
Execute grasp using the computed pose.
Confirm the grasp is secure before pulling.
High-level opening of the hinged fridge door (pull).
Back off to clear the open door.

failure_modes: Handle not detected due to occlusion or glare
Door binding or insufficient pull leading to partial opening
recovery_strategy: Re-scan with RetryUntilSuccessful and refresh detection
Re-align with tighter tolerance and reset yaw
Reopen gripper, recompute grasp, and retry pick
Repeat OpenContainer once after brief wait; if still blocked, retreat and abort
assumptions: Handle type appears to be a bar; using pull strategy
Hinged door opens toward the robot (left-hinged) as suggested by frames
AtOrientation=90 deg matches lateral pull posture; exact value inferred from visuals

expected_success_criteria: Door visually open; ContainerOpen true; robot clear of door
